item.title: Why is this forum
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

[quote="_s, post:101, topic:442441"][quote author=Aeolian link=topic=545072.msg3997402#msg3997402 date=1337469131]

[quote author=_s link=topic=545072.msg3996734#msg3996734 date=1337382690]

http://www.moparisthebest.com/origrs2/

This is not the original. Check the dates.
[/quote]what’s with the irritating signature

Only a pseudo-intellectual would find it irritating, are you admitting your self-fulfilled prophecy?
[/quote]i’m sure many intellectuals would find it irritating also since egotism is the core destructor of intellectual prosperity. oh also what kind of intellectual dismisses a file being an original based entirely on its modify date, i could download linux 0.1 and save all the files without any modifications just to update their modified date and i’m pretty sure people would still consider it linux 0.1.

also, if you look closely, the modify dates for the files are all exactly the same, which may hint at the webserver updating/(re)indexing them from when it sees the files in addition to any prior editing. Niall’s observation hints at this, but it could also be the result of mopar firing up a script which recursively changed files (unlikely)

edit: do a difference check between the 05 and the 09 ‘original’ files[/quote]

Read my response to your private message.

[quote=“Niall, post:98, topic:442441”][quote author=Aeolian link=topic=545072.msg3997402#msg3997402 date=1337469131]

[quote author=_s link=topic=545072.msg3996734#msg3996734 date=1337382690]

http://www.moparisthebest.com/origrs2/

This is not the original. Check the dates.
[/quote]what’s with the irritating signature

Only a pseudo-intellectual would find it irritating, are you admitting your self-fulfilled prophecy?

http://www.moparisthebest.com/origrs2/

This is not the original. Check the dates.

Not sure how MITB’s webservers work but is it possible the date was changed upon upload?

I’m not sure.[/quote]

most files that MITB host are from 2009-Dec-02 08:22:10, incidentally this is the earliest date of any file that MITB hosts[/quote]

Ahh, makes sense. Isn’t that around the time of the big prune as well?

Read full topic

also, if you look closely, the modify dates for the files are all exactly the same, which may hint at the webserver updating/(re)indexing them from when it sees the files in addition to any prior editing. Niall’s observation hints at this, but it could also be the result of mopar firing up a script which recursively changed files (unlikely)

edit: do a difference check between the 05 and the 09 ‘original’ files

item.title: Why is this forum
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

[quote="_s, post:90, topic:442441"][quote author=Aeolian link=topic=545072.msg3996723#msg3996723 date=1337382149]

http://www.moparisthebest.com/origrs2/

This is not the original. Check the dates.
[/quote]what’s with the irritating signature[/quote]

Only a pseudo-intellectual would find it irritating, are you admitting your self-fulfilled prophecy?

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:93, topic:442441”][quote author=Aeolian link=topic=545072.msg3996723#msg3996723 date=1337382149]

http://www.moparisthebest.com/origrs2/

This is not the original. Check the dates.
[/quote]
Not sure how MITB’s webservers work but is it possible the date was changed upon upload?[/quote]

I’m not sure. I know that for awhile there people were taking out and adding random snippets of code into the original and consistently uploading them trying to keep the original alive. I will post the original if I find the link again.

There is even evidence dating back to 2004 that suggests early development of RSPS.

http://web.archive.org/web/20050211191739/http://www.rscheatnet.org/forums/

EDIT:

Found this on my old PC back when I was actively on kaitnieks etc, this is the first concept of a server that I know of from 2005. As you can see it’s completely far from complete. (Still having half of it as txt files and todo lists.)

http://uppit.com/h9k4ilyc87sl/rs_project.rar

I’ll look for the first functional design and post it.

Btw, if you see a similar post on R-S, I am Jeff, super_ and I had a discussion about this which prompted me to create a thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is this forum
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:95, topic:442441”]the reason this forum has great success in sticking to RSPS is because the majority of the members cannot comprehend/do anything more than a simple copy&paste or regurgitating of poorly designed code.

[quote author=whackatre link=topic=545072.msg3996917#msg3996917 date=1337400226]

@david what makes you think the forum is dying? People have also been saying this for years yet everyday I see new posters. If anything is dying its the excitement of the subject matter. This is to be expected as almost everything has been reversed unlike 6 years ago when we all witnessed the first server with working still and projectile graphics,.
[/quote]Yes, RSPS as a whole is dying. In fact if you didn’t count the general discussion section and made a graph of the posts at Moparscape, I think the numbers would be down a lot. I’m not saying it isn’t fixable, Taharok agrees that there are things we could do to raise the excitement about Moparscape and RSPS development. Just think about this: how many potential people play RSPS, but don’t get into development because they aren’t sure where to start? Just a thought

I think we should raise the excitement more about actual programming instead of RSPS development. Like GameDev.

People will always be interested in actual programming. There are plenty of forums dedicated (with plenty of members), to actual programming. If RSPS died within the next year, there would still be a mass abundance of people interested in actual programming.

RSPS on the other hand, may not last forever. I predict that eventually there will be a revolution. Either the RSPS entirety as a whole will shrink to nothing, or someone will pull off something largely impressive, similar to things that have happened previously in RSPS history (eg, SWAT’s hardcoded anims from way back in the day.)

-Just my two cents.

I totally agree. There are many communities dedicated to programming, but for some reason, I still stick to this one. ;D

because of this, naturally, they will not fit in to a competent general programming community. and in turn, stay here.[/quote]

That’s me.

Read full topic

I think we should raise the excitement more about actual programming instead of RSPS development. Like GameDev.

People will always be interested in actual programming. There are plenty of forums dedicated (with plenty of members), to actual programming. If RSPS died within the next year, there would still be a mass abundance of people interested in actual programming.

RSPS on the other hand, may not last forever. I predict that eventually there will be a revolution. Either the RSPS entirety as a whole will shrink to nothing, or someone will pull off something largely impressive, similar to things that have happened previously in RSPS history (eg, SWAT’s hardcoded anims from way back in the day.)

-Just my two cents.

I totally agree. There are many communities dedicated to programming, but for some reason, I still stick to this one. ;D[/quote]
because of this, naturally, they will not fit in to a competent general programming community. and in turn, stay here.

It’s ironic actually, because they have a no flame rule, and EVERYONE breaks that.

take this from one of the people who helped ‘create’ the revolutions over at RL: everyone there is pretty fucking retarded
[/quote]

the implication of calling someone a retard does in fact imply they are mentally handicapped.
when we say retard we mean retard.
